result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian M Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: Consecutive to the prison & jail sentences in La Crosse Co cases 14CM1160, 15CF241 & 15CF137
.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Undergo a mental health evaluation and comply with treatment recommendations
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

The def is not to be present at any place where alcohol is served for consumption

The def is not to be present at any place where illicit drugs or controlled substances are kept, found, used or sold

No Contact with users or traffickers of illicit drugs or controlled substances

No Contact with C.F., her residence or her children

No Contact with Mr. L. or his residence during the period of supervision
.

Complete any other assessment or treatment PO deems necessary

Pay restitution and surcharge as shown in 15CF241

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt
